title: Department of Technological Equipment and Control Systems

firstPersonCard.name: Semenov Yuriy Stanislavovych
firstPersonCard.description: Candidate of Technical Sciences, Senior Researcher
firstPersonCard.researchDirection: Development of: comprehensive methods and techniques for blast furnace control, including using new monitoring tools; mathematical models of charging processes and distribution of charge materials in blast furnaces; intelligent decision support systems for blast furnace smelting control; technology for charging blast furnaces with multicomponent charge materials.
firstPersonCard.specialization: 05.16.02 «Metallurgy of Ferrous and Non-Ferrous Metals and Special Alloys»

items: Theoretical and experimental research on the influence of physical-mechanical and technological characteristics of fine-grained charge materials on the pressing process, quality of finished products (briquettes) and their metallurgical properties; development of briquetting technological regimes; work on improving the design and technical characteristics of pressing equipment.

Scientific research on operating regimes of technological equipment in complex with drive and automated control systems in blast furnace, steelmaking and rolling shops when improving existing and implementing new technological processes, as well as when mastering production of new types of products.
Development of information systems for blast furnace smelting process control, including mathematical models of the process and their software implementation.
Development of technology for charging blast furnaces with charge materials and its adaptation to specific facilities.
Development of methods and techniques for diagnosing the technical condition of rolling mill equipment based on patterns of transient process parameter changes.
Statistical modeling of dynamic loads, determination of load spectrum and development of methods for predicting equipment residual life.
Development of methods to reduce impact loads during strip gripping by rolls and vibration process levels in rolling mills.

Research of dynamics of interaction through the rolled strip of multi-stand mill groups and the influence of disturbances on interstand tensions and longitudinal thickness variation and its reduction.
